item.title: Jason add a quote by Epictetus
item.description: "Any person capable of angering you becomes your master; he can anger you only when you permit yourself to be disturbed by him." -- Epictetus

item.title: Jason add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jason add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "Your critics are the ones telling you they still love you and care. Worry when you do something badly and nobody bothers to tell you." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Jason add a quote by Plutarch
item.description: "To make no mistakes is not in the power of man; but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future." -- Plutarch

item.title: Jason add a quote by Randall Munroe
item.description: "Why did you fill your apartment with playpen balls?" Because we're grown-ups now, and it's our turn to decide what that means." -- Randall Munroe

item.title: Jason add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Jason add a quote by H. L. Mencken
item.description: "Under democracy one party always devotes its chief energies to trying to prove that the other party is unfit to ruleâ€”and both commonly succeed, and are right." -- H. L. Mencken
